security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate code execution sandbox skill. Network is disabled, filesystem access is restricted to /data directory, and code runs in an isolated Docker container with memory limits and 90-second timeout. No malicious behavior detected.

content.user_title: Execute Python code for data analysis
content.value_statement: Need to analyze data, create charts, or generate reports? This sandbox lets AI assistants run Python code securely with full library support for Pandas, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, and document generation tools.
actual_capabilities: Execute Python code in a secure, isolated Docker container
Data analysis with Pandas, NumPy, DuckDB for SQL-like queries
Create charts and visualizations with Matplotlib, Seaborn, Graphviz
Generate Excel, Word, PDF, and PowerPoint documents
Build machine learning models with scikit-learn, LightGBM, XGBoost
Scientific computing with SciPy and symbolic math with SymPy
limitations: Filesystem access restricted to /data directory only
Network access is completely disabled for security

use_cases.title: Data Analysis
use_cases.description: Clean datasets, perform statistical analysis, and create visualizations for business insights.

use_cases.title: ML Model Building
use_cases.description: Train classification, regression, and time series models with scikit-learn and XGBoost.

use_cases.title: Report Generation
use_cases.description: Generate automated Excel reports, Word documents, and PDF presentations from data.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Chart
prompt_templates.prompt: Read data.csv from /data and create a bar chart showing sales by category using Matplotlib. Save the chart and display it.

prompt_templates.title: Data Summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the Excel file from /data, show basic statistics, and create a summary report with key metrics.

prompt_templates.title: ML Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a classification model using the uploaded dataset. Split into train/test, evaluate accuracy, and show feature importance.

prompt_templates.title: Document Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a professional PDF report with analysis results, include charts from the data analysis, and output as downloadable file.

output_examples.input: Analyze the sales data and create a chart
output: Data loaded successfully: 1,250 rows Ã— 8 columns
Key metrics: Total sales Â¥2.3M, Average Â¥1,840
Chart generated showing monthly sales trend

best_practices: Use DuckDB for large datasets (av loading entire file into memory)
Save intermediate results to /data for multi-step workflows
Call plt.show() to trigger chart capture and display
Break complex analyses into multiple sequential code blocks
anti_patterns: Loading entire 100MB+ CSV into Pandas without chunking
Missing plt.show() call after creating charts
Generating multiple output files in a single code execution
Using class definitions (not supported in sandbox environment)

faq.question: What Python libraries are available?
faq.answer: Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, LightGBM, XGBoost, SymPy, and many more for data science tasks.

faq.question: How large files can I process?
faq.answer: Files up to 50MB work directly. For larger files, use chunked reading or DuckDB for memory-efficient SQL queries.

faq.question: Can this access my local files?
faq.answer: No. The sandbox only accesses files uploaded to the /data directory. System files are read-only and network is disabled.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: Yes. The sandbox runs in an isolated Docker container, network is disabled, and sessions are cleared after 24 hours of inactivity.

faq.question: Why is my code timing out?
faq.answer: Code execution has a 90-second limit. Optimize by using efficient libraries like DuckDB, processing in chunks, or splitting into steps.

faq.question: How is this different from local Python?
faq.answer: This sandbox provides consistent, reproducible environments with pre-installed libraries and automatic chart capture for AI assistant workflows.
